wikipedia_page.main: Philip Twells (1808 – 8 May 1880) was a Conservative Party politician.

response: *Philip Twells (1808–1880), MP for City of London (1874–1880)

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the 1874 United Kingdom general election

response: Twells married Mary Line, daughter of Joseph Line of Alum Rock, Worcestershire, and they had two sons, the Rev. John Twells and Philip Twells M.P. Matthias Attwood M.P. was a connection in the London & Greenwich, where he was treasurer, and in the bank. He was also a connection by marriage, having married Susanna Twells, daughter of Twells's brother William.
*Georgina Twells (d. 1898)History, Art and Heritage. St Mary Magdalene's Church, Enfield. Retrieved 11 September 2015. and Philip Twells, M.P. (d. 1880)

The church was built as a memorial to Philip Twells, MP and city banker, by his wife Georgiana Twells, who employed the architect William Butterfield. The foundation was stone was laid in 1881 and the church opened in 1883. Charles Edgar Buckeridge created much of the interior art.
